name: methylseq-targeted-analysis
title: Targeted Bisulfite-seq Methylation Analysis
description: Deep methylation profiling of specific genomic regions. Cost-effective analysis of targeted loci including promoters, CpG islands, or candidate regions with high coverage.
content:
Targeted Bisulfite Sequencing

Targeted methylation sequencing focuses on specific genomic regions of interest (promoters, candidate genes, CpG islands) with deep coverage at a fraction of the cost of whole-genome bisulfite sequencing.

What is Targeted Methylation Analysis?

Instead of sequencing the entire methylome (WGBS), target specific regions using:

  • Capture-based: Hybridization probes enrich target regions
  • Amplicon-based: PCR amplify specific loci
  • Reduced Representation (RRBS): MspI digestion enriches CpG-rich regions

Result: 100-1000X coverage of targets vs 30X whole-genome

Why Targeted Methylation?

  • Cost-Effective: $100s vs $1000s for WGBS
  • High Coverage: 100-1000X depth for confident methylation calls
  • Focused Hypothesis: Specific candidate genes or pathways
  • Large Cohorts: Affordable to sequence 100s of samples
  • Clinical Validation: Deep coverage for diagnostic assays
  • Rare Variants: Detect low-frequency methylation changes

Target Region Strategies

Promoter Panels:

  • All gene promoters (TSS ± 1kb)
  • CpG islands overlapping promoters
  • Typical targets: 20K-30K promoters
  • Use case: Gene expression regulation

Candidate Gene Panels:

  • Specific genes (e.g., tumor suppressors)
  • Disease-associated loci from GWAS
  • Imprinted gene clusters
  • Use case: Focused disease studies

CpG Island Panels:

  • All ~28K CpG islands
  • CpG shores (±2kb from islands)
  • Use case: Cancer methylation biomarkers

Custom Regions:

  • User-defined BED file
  • Regulatory elements from ATAC/ChIP-seq
  • Enhancers, insulators, specific loci

Applications by Target Type

Cancer Panels:

  • Tumor suppressors: BRCA1, VHL, MLH1, CDKN2A, TP53
  • DNA repair genes: MGMT (predicts temozolomide response)
  • Differentiation genes: HOX clusters
  • Use case: Cancer subtyping, prognosis, therapy prediction

Imprinting Panels:

  • Imprinted loci: H19/IGF2, SNRPN, MEG3, KCNQ1OT1
  • Differentially methylated regions (DMRs)
  • Use case: Imprinting disorders (BWS, PWS, AS)

Aging Panels:

  • Horvath clock CpGs: 353 sites predicting age
  • Hannum clock: 71 sites
  • Use case: Biological age estimation, aging research

Neurological Panels:

  • Neurodevelopmental genes: MECP2, FMR1
  • Synaptic genes: BDNF, NR3C1
  • Use case: Rett syndrome, autism, stress response

RRBS: Special Case of Targeted BS-seq

Reduced Representation Bisulfite Sequencing:

  • Method: MspI digestion (cuts at CCGG) → size select 40-220bp
  • Enriches: CpG islands, promoters (CG-rich regions)
  • Coverage: ~10% of CpGs, but includes most regulatory regions
  • Cost: 5-10X cheaper than WGBS
  • Use case: Differential methylation screening, large cohorts

Pipeline Analysis

  1. Quality Control: FastQC, adapter trimming
  2. Target Region Check: Verify on-target rate
  3. Bisulfite Alignment: Bismark or bwa-meth
  4. Target Coverage: Per-region depth analysis
  5. Methylation Extraction: Per-CpG calls in target regions
  6. Differential Methylation: Compare groups (DMRs)
  7. Annotation: Gene/feature annotation
  8. Visualization: IGV tracks, locus plots

QC Metrics for Targeted BS-seq

  • On-Target Rate: % reads mapping to targets (should be >50%)
  • Mean Target Coverage: Average depth per target region
  • Uniformity: % targets with ≥100X coverage
  • Bisulfite Conversion: >99% (check lambda DNA spike-in)
  • Duplication Rate: PCR duplicates (expected to be higher for targeted)

Scientific Questions

  • Candidate Gene Validation: Is BRCA1 promoter hypermethylated in this tumor?
  • Biomarker Discovery: Which promoters are differentially methylated in disease?
  • Clinical Diagnostics: MGMT methylation status (predicts glioblastoma therapy)
  • Imprinting Defects: Loss of imprinting in BWS/AS/PWS
  • Epigenetic Age: Biological age from Horvath clock CpGs
  • Large Cohorts: Screen 100s of samples for differential methylation

Example: Cancer Methylation Panel

Question: Which tumor suppressors are hypermethylated in colorectal cancer?

Design:

  • Target: Promoters of 50 tumor suppressors (MLH1, BRCA1, VHL, CDKN2A, etc.)
  • Samples: 100 tumors vs 20 normal colon
  • Coverage: 500X per promoter

Analysis:

  • Identify hypermethylated promoters (>50% methylation in tumors)
  • Correlate with gene expression (RNA-seq)
  • Subtype tumors by methylation patterns (CpG Island Methylator Phenotype, CIMP)

Outcome:

  • MLH1 hypermethylation in 15% of tumors → microsatellite instability
  • CIMP-high subtype identified (multiple hypermethylated genes)

Applications

  • Cancer Diagnostics: MGMT methylation (glioblastoma), SEPT9 (colorectal cancer blood test)
  • Imprinting Disorders: Clinical testing for BWS, AS, PWS
  • Pharmacogenomics: Methylation predicts drug response (MGMT, DPYD)
  • Aging Research: Epigenetic clocks in large cohorts
  • Environmental Epigenetics: Toxin/diet effects on candidate genes
  • Population Studies: EWAS (epigenome-wide association) on custom panels

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with columns:

  • sample: Sample name
  • fastq_1: Path to R1 FASTQ
  • fastq_2: Path to R2 FASTQ (for paired-end)

BED file with target regions:

  • chr, start, end, name (optional)
  • Define regions to analyze

Key Outputs

  • Per-Target Methylation: Average methylation per target region
  • Per-CpG Calls: Single-base resolution within targets
  • Coverage Reports: On-target rate, depth per region
  • Differential Methylation: DMRs in target regions
  • Gene Annotation: Genes overlapping targets
  • Visualizations: Locus browser tracks (BigWig)
  • QC Report: MultiQC with target metrics

Perfect for: Candidate genes • Cancer panels • Imprinting • Biomarkers • Large cohorts • Clinical diagnostics • Cost-effective
